first_reading.text:
[[Tt 2,1]]Beloved, you must say what is consistent with sound doctrine, namely,
[[Tt 2,2]]that older men should be temperate, dignified, self-controlled, sound in faith, love, and endurance.
[[Tt 2,3]]Similarly, older women should be reverent in their behavior, not slanderers, not addicted to drink, teaching what is good,
[[Tt 2,4]]so that they may train younger women to love their husbands and children,
[[Tt 2,5]]to be self-controlled, chaste, good homemakers, under the control of their husbands, so that the word of God may not be discredited.
[[Tt 2,6]]Urge the younger men, similarly, to control themselves,
[[Tt 2,7]]showing yourself as a model of good deeds in every respect, with integrity in your teaching, dignity,
[[Tt 2,8]]and sound speech that cannot be criticized, so that the opponent will be put to shame without anything bad to say about us.
[[Tt 2,11]]For the grace of God has appeared, saving all
[[Tt 2,12]]and training us to reject godless ways and worldly desires and to live temperately, justly, and devoutly in this age,
[[Tt 2,13]]as we await the blessed hope, the appearance of the glory of the great God and of our savior Jesus Christ,
[[Tt 2,14]]who gave himself for us to deliver us from all lawlessness and to cleanse for himself a people as his own, eager to do what is good.
first_reading.title: Letter to Titus

psalm.text:
[[Ps 37,3]]Trust in the LORD and do good, 
that you may dwell in the land and be fed in security.
[[Ps 37,4]]Take delight in the LORD, 
and he will grant you your heart's requests.

[[Ps 37,18]]The LORD watches over the lives of the wholehearted; 
their inheritance lasts forever.
[[Ps 37,23]]By the LORD are the steps of a man made firm, 
and he approves his way.

[[Ps 37,27]]Turn from evil and do good, 
that you may abide forever;
[[Ps 37,29]]The just shall possess the land 
and dwell in it forever.
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Lc 17,7]]Jesus said to the Apostles: “Who among you would say to your servant who has just come in from plowing or tending sheep in the field, ‘Come here immediately and take your place at table’?
[[Lc 17,8]]Would he not rather say to him, 'Prepare something for me to eat. Put on your apron and wait on me while I eat and drink. You may eat and drink when I am finished'?
[[Lc 17,9]]Is he grateful to that servant because he did what was commanded?
[[Lc 17,10]]So should it be with you. When you have done all you have been commanded, say, 'We are unprofitable servants; we have done what we were obliged to do.'"
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
